arabicText: وَلِسُلَيْمَـٰنَ ٱلرِّيحَ عَاصِفَةًۭ تَجْرِى بِأَمْرِهِۦٓ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلَّتِى بَـٰرَكْنَا فِيهَا ۚ وَكُنَّا بِكُلِّ شَىْءٍ عَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	subjected	the	fast	wind	for	Sulaiman,	which	moved	by	his	command	towards	the	land	
in	which	We	have	placed	blessings;	and	We	know	everything
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Sulaimān ke	liye	tez	hawā	musakhkhar	kardi	ke	Uske	hukm	se	chalti	us	zameen	ki	taraf	jis	
meiñ	hamne	barkat	rakhi	aur	ham	ko	har	cheez	m’aloom	hai

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينِ مَن يَغُوصُونَ لَهُۥ وَيَعْمَلُونَ عَمَلًۭا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ وَكُنَّا لَهُمْ حَـٰفِظِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 among	 the	 devils,	 were	 those	 who	
dived	 (in	 water)	 for	 him	 and	 did	 works	
other	 than	 this;	 and	 We	 had	 kept	 them	
restrained.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 shaitānoñ	 meiñ	 se	 woh	 jo	 Uske	 liye	
gotā	 lagāte	 aur	 uske	 siwā	 aur	 kām	 karte	
aur	ham	unheiñ	roke	huye	they

arabicText: ۞ وَأَيُّوبَ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّى مَسَّنِىَ ٱلضُّرُّ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 Ayyub	 (Job),	 when	 he	
called	 his	 Lord	 that,	 “Hardship	 has	
afflicted	 me,	 and	 You	 are	 the	 Most	
Merciful	of	all	those	who	have	mercy.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Ayyub ko	yād	karo!	Jab	usne	apne	Rab	
ko	pukārā	ke	mujhe	 takleef	pahuñchi	aur	
tu	 sab	 mehar	 wāloñ	 se	 badhkar	 mehar	
wāla	hai

arabicText: فَٱسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُۥ فَكَشَفْنَا مَا بِهِۦ مِن ضُرٍّۢ ۖ وَءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ أَهْلَهُۥ وَمِثْلَهُم مَّعَهُمْ رَحْمَةًۭ مِّنْ عِندِنَا وَذِكْرَىٰ لِلْعَـٰبِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	 therefore	 heard	 his	 prayer	 and	
removed	 the	 adversity	 that	 had	 afflicted	
him,	 and	 We	 gave	 him	 his	 family	 and	 in	
addition	 bestowed	 along	 with	 them	 a	
similar	number,	by	mercy	from	Ourselves	
- and	 an	 advice	 for	 the	 people	 who	
worship.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	hamne	uski	Du’ā	sun	li	to	hamne	door	
kardi	 jo	 takleef	 usey	 thi	 aur	 hamne	 usey	
uske	 ghar	wāle	 aur	unke	 sāth	itne	 hi	 aur	
‘atā	 kiye	 apne	 pās	 se	 Raḥmat	 farmā	 kar	
aur	bandagi	wāloñ	ke	liye	naseehat

arabicText: وَإِسْمَـٰعِيلَ وَإِدْرِيسَ وَذَا ٱلْكِفْلِ ۖ كُلٌّۭ مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 Ismail,	 and	 Idrees,	 and	
Zul-Kifl;	they	were	all	patiently	enduring.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Ismā’il aur	 Idris aur	 Zul-kifl (ko	 yād	
karo)	woh	sab	sabr	wāle	they

arabicText: وَأَدْخَلْنَـٰهُمْ فِى رَحْمَتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّهُم مِّنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 unheiñ	 Hamne	 apni	 Raḥmat	 meiñ	
dākhil	kiya	be-shak	woh	hamāre	Qurb	-ekhās	ke	sazā-wāroñ	meiñ	hai

arabicText: وَذَا ٱلنُّونِ إِذ ذَّهَبَ مُغَـٰضِبًۭا فَظَنَّ أَن لَّن نَّقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ فَنَادَىٰ فِى ٱلظُّلُمَـٰتِ أَن لَّآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنتَ سُبْحَـٰنَكَ إِنِّى كُنتُ مِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 Zun-Noon,	 *	when	 he	left	
in	 anger,	 assuming	 that	 We	 would	 not	
restrict	 him	 - he	 therefore	 called	 out	 in	
the	 realms	 of	 darkness,	 saying,	 “There	 is	
no	God	except	You,	Purity	is	to	You;	I	have	
indeed	committed	a	lapse.”	(*	Prophet	Yunus	- peace	and	blessings	upon	him)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Zun-noon (ko	 yād	 karo)	 jab	 chalā	
gusse	 meiñ	 bharā	 to	 gumān	 kiya	 ke	 ham	
uspar	 tangi	 na	 kareñge	 to	 andheriyoñ	
meiñ	pukārā	koi	m’abood	nahiñ	siwā	tere,	
pāki	hai	tujhko	be-shak	mujhse	be-jā	huā

arabicText: فَٱسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُۥ وَنَجَّيْنَـٰهُ مِنَ ٱلْغَمِّ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نُـۨجِى ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	 therefore	heard	his	prayer	and	rescued	him	 from	grief;	and	similarly	We	shall	rescue	 the	
Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	hamne	uski	pukār	sunli	aur	usey	gam	se	najāt	bakhshi	aur	aisi	hi	najāt	deñge	Musalmānoñ	
ko

arabicText: وَزَكَرِيَّآ إِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبَّهُۥ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْنِى فَرْدًۭا وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْوَٰرِثِينَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	remember	Zakaria,	when	he	prayed	to	his	Lord,	“O	my	Lord	- do	not	leave	me	alone,	and	
You	are	the	Best	Inheritor.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Zakariyā ko	jab	usne	apne	rab	ko	pukārā,	aye	mere	Rab	mujhe	akelā	na	chord aur	tu	sabse	
behtar	wāris

arabicText: فَٱسْتَجَبْنَا لَهُۥ وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥ يَحْيَىٰ وَأَصْلَحْنَا لَهُۥ زَوْجَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ يُسَـٰرِعُونَ فِى ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ وَيَدْعُونَنَا رَغَبًۭا وَرَهَبًۭا ۖ وَكَانُوا۟ لَنَا خَـٰشِعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	 therefore	 heard	 his	 prayer;	and	 bestowed	 him	 Yahya,	and	 cured	 his	wife	 for	 him;	indeed	
they	 used	 to	 hasten	 to	 perform	 good	 deeds,	 and	 pray	 to	Us	with	 hope	 and	 fear;	 and	 used	 to	
weep	before	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	Hamne	uski	Du’ā	Qubool	ki	aur	usey	Yāḥyā ‘atā	farmāyā	aur	uske	liye	uski	bibi	suwāñri,	beshak	woh	bhale	kāmoñ	meiñ	jaldi	karte	they	aur	Hameiñ	pukārte	they	ummeed	aur	khauf	se	aur	
hamāre	huzoor	gid-girdāte	haiñ.

arabicText: وَٱلَّتِىٓ أَحْصَنَتْ فَرْجَهَا فَنَفَخْنَا فِيهَا مِن رُّوحِنَا وَجَعَلْنَـٰهَا وَٱبْنَهَآ ءَايَةًۭ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 remember	 the	 woman	 who	
maintained	 her	 chastity,	 We therefore	
breathed	Our	Spirit	into	her	and	made	her	
and	her	son	a	sign	for	the	entire	world.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 us	 aurat	 ko	 jisne	 apni	 pārsāyi	 nigāh	
rakhi	 to	 hamne	 us	 meiñ	 Apni	 Rooh	
phooñki	 aur	 usey	 aur	 uske	 bete	 ko	 sāre	
jahān	ke	liye	nishāni	banāyā

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦٓ أُمَّتُكُمْ أُمَّةًۭ وَٰحِدَةًۭ وَأَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمْ فَٱعْبُدُونِ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 this	 religion	 of	 yours,	 is	 one	
religion;	 and	 I	 am	 your	 Lord,	 therefore	
worship	Me.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tumhārā	yeh	deen	ek	hi	deen	hai		
aur	maiñ	tumhārā	Rab	huñ	to	meri	ibādat	
karo	.

arabicText: وَتَقَطَّعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَهُم بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلٌّ إِلَيْنَا رَٰجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 others	 have	 shattered	 their	 works	
into	pieces	among	themselves;	all	have	to	
return	to	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	auroñ	ne	Apne	kām	āpas	meiñ	tukdetukde	 karliye	 sabko	 Hamāri	 taraf	 phirnā	
hai

arabicText: فَمَن يَعْمَلْ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَهُوَ مُؤْمِنٌۭ فَلَا كُفْرَانَ لِسَعْيِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَهُۥ كَـٰتِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	whoever	does	some	good	deeds,	and	is	
a	 believer,	 then	 his	 efforts	 will	 not	 be	
ignored;	and	We	are	recording	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 jo	 kuch	 bhale	 kām	 kare	 aur	 ho	 Imān		
wāla	 to	 uski	 koshish	 ki	 be-qadri	 nhi,	 aur	
ham	usey	likh	rahe	haiñ.

arabicText: وَحَرَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهَآ أَنَّهُمْ لَا يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 it	 is	 forbidden	 for	 any	 township	
which	We	 have	 destroyed,	 that	 they	may	
return.	 (Once	 the	 disbelievers	 face	 death,	
their	return	to	earth	is	impossible.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	 harām	 hai	 us	 basti	 par	 jise	 hamne	
halāk	kardiyā	ke	phir	laut	kar	āyeiñ

arabicText: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فُتِحَتْ يَأْجُوجُ وَمَأْجُوجُ وَهُم مِّن كُلِّ حَدَبٍۢ يَنسِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Till	 the	 time	 when	 Yajuj	 and	 Majuj	 are	
released,	 and	 they	 will	 be	 flowing	 down	
from	every	height.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yahāñ	tak	ke	jab	khole	jayeiñge	Yājooj-o-Mājooj		aur		woh	har	bulandi	se	dhalakte	hoñge

arabicText: وَٱقْتَرَبَ ٱلْوَعْدُ ٱلْحَقُّ فَإِذَا هِىَ شَـٰخِصَةٌ أَبْصَـٰرُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ يَـٰوَيْلَنَا قَدْ كُنَّا فِى غَفْلَةٍۢ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا بَلْ كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 True	 Promise	 has	 come	 near	 -
thereupon	 the	 eyes	 of	 the	 disbelievers	
will	 become	 fixed,	 staring	 wide;	 saying	
“Woe	to	us	- we	were	in	neglect	of	this,	but	in	fact	we	were	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	qareeb	āayā	sachchā	w’ada	to	jabhi	āñkheiñ	phat	kar	rah	jayeiñgi	kāfiroñ	ki	ke	Hāye	hamāri	
kharābi	be-shak	ham	is-se	gaflat	meiñ	they	balke	ham	ƶālim	they

arabicText: إِنَّكُمْ وَمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ حَصَبُ جَهَنَّمَ أَنتُمْ لَهَا وَٰرِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	you	*	and	all	that	you	worship	**	besides	Allah,	are	the	fuel	of	hell;	in	it	you	must	go.”	(*	
All	disbelievers	**	Idols	and	disbelievers	who	claimed	to	be	Gods.	The	Prophets	like	Eisa	and	Uzair	
who	were	worshipped	are	exempt	from	this,	so	are	Maryam,	trees,	the	moon	etc.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	 tum,	aur	jo	kuch Allah	ke	siwā	 tum	poojte ho	sab	 Jahannam	ke	iñdhan	ho	 tumheiñ	is	
meiñ	jānā

arabicText: لَوْ كَانَ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ءَالِهَةًۭ مَّا وَرَدُوهَا ۖ وَكُلٌّۭ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText: “Had	these	been	Gods	they	would	not	go	into	hell;	and	they	have	to	remain	in	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Agar	yeh	khudā	hote	Jahannam	meiñ	na	jāte	aur	in	sabko	hamesha	us	meiñ	rehnā

arabicText: لَهُمْ فِيهَا زَفِيرٌۭ وَهُمْ فِيهَا لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText: They	will	bray	in	it	and	not	be	able	to	hear	anything	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	us	meiñ	reñkeñ	(Cheekheñ	Chillāye)	ge	aur	woh	us	meiñ	kuch	na	suneñge

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ سَبَقَتْ لَهُم مِّنَّا ٱلْحُسْنَىٰٓ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ عَنْهَا مُبْعَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	those to	whom	Our	promise	of	goodness	has	been	made,	have	been	kept	far	away	from	
hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	woh	jinke	liye	hamārā	wā’da	bhalāyi	ka	ho	chukā	woh	 Jahannam	se	door	rakhe	gaye	
haiñ

arabicText: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ حَسِيسَهَا ۖ وَهُمْ فِى مَا ٱشْتَهَتْ أَنفُسُهُمْ خَـٰلِدُونَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	 uski	 bhinak	 (Halki	 si	 āwāz bhi)	 na	
suneñge	 aur	 woh	 apni	 man-mānti	
khwāhishoñ	meiñ	hamesha	raheñge

arabicText: لَا يَحْزُنُهُمُ ٱلْفَزَعُ ٱلْأَكْبَرُ وَتَتَلَقَّىٰهُمُ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ هَـٰذَا يَوْمُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُمْ تُوعَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	 greatest	 fear	 will	 not	 aggrieve	 them,	
and	the	angels	will	welcome	them;	saying	
“This	 is	 your	 day,	 which	 you	 were	
promised.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unheiñ	 gham	 meiñ	 na	 dālegi	 woh	 sabse	
badi	 ghabrāhat	 aur	 Firishte	 unki	
peshwāyi	 ko	 ayeñge	 ke	 yeh	 hai	 tumhārā	
woh	din	jiskā	tumse	w’ada	thā

arabicText: يَوْمَ نَطْوِى ٱلسَّمَآءَ كَطَىِّ ٱلسِّجِلِّ لِلْكُتُبِ ۚ كَمَا بَدَأْنَآ أَوَّلَ خَلْقٍۢ نُّعِيدُهُۥ ۚ وَعْدًا عَلَيْنَآ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا فَـٰعِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	 day	 when	 We	 shall	 roll	 up	 the	
heavens	 as	 the	 recording	 angel	 rolls	 up	
the	 register	of	deeds;	We	shall	make	him	
similar	 to	Our	making	 him	 the	 first	 time;	
this	 is	 a	 promise	 upon	 Us;	 We	 certainly	
have	to	do	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	ham	āsmān	ko	lapeteñge	jaise	Sijil	
Firishta	 Nā’mā-e-A’āmāl	 ko	 lapet-ta	 hai	
jaise	pehle	usey	banāyā	 thā	waise	hi	phir	
kardeñge,	 yeh	 w’ada	 hai	 hamāre	 zimme	
hamko	iska	zaroor	karnā

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ كَتَبْنَا فِى ٱلزَّبُورِ مِنۢ بَعْدِ ٱلذِّكْرِ أَنَّ ٱلْأَرْضَ يَرِثُهَا عِبَادِىَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	wrote,	after	the	reminder	
in	the	Zaboor	that,	“My	virtuous	bondmen	
will	inherit	the	earth.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	be-shak	hamne	zaboor	meiñ	naseehat	
ke	 b’ad	 likh	 diyā	 ke	 is	 zameen	 ke	 wāris	
mere	nek	bande	hoñge

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى هَـٰذَا لَبَلَـٰغًۭا لِّقَوْمٍ عَـٰبِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
. This	 Qur’an	 is	 sufficient	 for	 people	 who	
are	devout.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	 yeh	Qu’rān	kāfi	hai	ibādat	wāloñ	
ko

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ إِلَّا رَحْمَةًۭ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	did	not	send	you	(O	dear	Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	 except	 as	 a	 mercy	 for	 the	 entire	
world.	 (Prophet	 Muhammad – peace	 and	
blessings	 be	 upon	 him	 – is	 the	 Prophet	
towards	all	mankind.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Hamne	 Tumheiñ na	 bhejā	 (aey	
Mehboob	 Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم 	(magar	 Raḥmat	
sāre	jahān	ke	liye

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّمَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ أَنَّمَآ إِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ ۖ فَهَلْ أَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	 “It	 is	 divinely	 revealed	 to	 me that	 your	 God	 is	 the	 only	 One	 God	 - Allah;	 do	 you	
therefore	become	Muslims?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 farmāo:	Mujhe	 to	yehi	waḥi	hoti	hai	ke	 tumhārā	khudā	nahiñ	magar	ek	Allah	 to	kya	 tum	
Musalmān	hote	ho?

arabicText: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا۟ فَقُلْ ءَاذَنتُكُمْ عَلَىٰ سَوَآءٍۢ ۖ وَإِنْ أَدْرِىٓ أَقَرِيبٌ أَم بَعِيدٌۭ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Then	if	 they	 turn	 away,	 proclaim,	 “I	 have	 proclaimed	 a	war	 against	 you	 on	 equal	 terms;	 and	
what	do	I	know	whether	the	promise	which	is	given	to	you,	is	close	or	far?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	agar	woh	muñh	phereñ	to	farmā	do	maiñ	ne	tumheiñ	ladāyi	ka	a’elān	kar	diyā	barābari	par	
aur	maiñ	kya	jānuñ	ke	pās	hai	yā	door	hai	woh	jo	tumheiñ w’āda	diyā	jātā	hai

arabicText: إِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تَكْتُمُونَ
englishTranslationText: “Indeed	Allah knows	whatever	is	said,	and	knows	all	what	you	conceal.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	Allah	jāntā	hai	āwāz	ki	bāt	aur	jānta	hai	jo	tum	chupāte	ho

arabicText: وَإِنْ أَدْرِى لَعَلَّهُۥ فِتْنَةٌۭ لَّكُمْ وَمَتَـٰعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: “And	what	do	I	know	- it	may	be	a	trial	for	you,	and	an	enjoyment	for	a	time.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	maiñ	kya	jānuñ	shāyad	woh	tumhāri	jāñch	ho	aur	ek	waqt	tak	barat-wānā

arabicText: قَـٰلَ رَبِّ ٱحْكُم بِٱلْحَقِّ ۗ وَرَبُّنَا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ ٱلْمُسْتَعَانُ عَلَىٰ مَا تَصِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Prophet	submitted,	“My	Lord	- render	the	true	judgement”;	“And	only	the	help	of	Our	
Lord,	the	Most	Gracious,	is	sought	against	all	what	you	fabricate.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Nabi	 ne	 ‘arz	 ki	 ke	 aey	 mere	Rab!	Haq	 faislā	 farmā	 de	 aur	 hamāre	Rab	 Rahmān	 hi	 ki	 Madad	
darkār	un	bātoñ	par	jo	tum	batāte	ho

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ ٱتَّقُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ زَلْزَلَةَ ٱلسَّاعَةِ شَىْءٌ عَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
O	 people,	 fear	 your	 Lord;	 indeed	 the	
earthquake	 of	 the	 Last	 Day	 is	 a	
tremendous	thing
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aye	 logo!	 Apne	 Rab	 se	 daro,	 be-shak	
Qayāmat	ka	zalzalā	badi	sakht	cheez	hai.

arabicText: يَوْمَ تَرَوْنَهَا تَذْهَلُ كُلُّ مُرْضِعَةٍ عَمَّآ أَرْضَعَتْ وَتَضَعُ كُلُّ ذَاتِ حَمْلٍ حَمْلَهَا وَتَرَى ٱلنَّاسَ سُكَـٰرَىٰ وَمَا هُم بِسُكَـٰرَىٰ وَلَـٰكِنَّ عَذَابَ ٱللَّهِ شَدِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
On	 the	 day	 when	 you	 will	 witness	 it,	
every	 nursing	 mother	 will	 forget	 her	
nurseling	 and	 every	 pregnant	 one	 will	
discharge	 her	 burden,	 and	 you	 (O	 dear	
Prophet	Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	
be	upon	him)	will	see	people	as	if	they	are	
drunk,	 whereas	 they	 will	 not	 be	
intoxicated,	 but	 the	 fact	 is	 that	 Allah’s	
punishment	is	very	severe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	 din	 tum	 usey	 dekhoge	 har	 doodh	
pilāne	 wāli	 apne	 doodh	 peete	 ko	 bhool	
jayegi,	aur	har	gābhini	apnā	gābh	dāl	degi	
aur	tu	logoñ	ko	dekhegā	jaise	nashe	meiñ	
haiñ	aur	nashe	meiñ	na	hoñge	magar	hai
yeh	ke	Allah	ki	mār	kadi	hai

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يُجَـٰدِلُ فِى ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍۢ وَيَتَّبِعُ كُلَّ شَيْطَـٰنٍۢ مَّرِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	 among	 people	 are	 some	 who	 argue	
concerning	 Allah without	 knowing,	 and	
blindly	follow	every	rebellious	devil.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kuch log	 woh	 haiñ ke	 Allah	 ke	
mu’āmle	 meiñ	 jhagardte	 haiñ	 be-jāne	
bujhe	 aur	 har	 sarkash	 shaitān	 ke	peeche	
ho	lete	haiñ

arabicText: كُتِبَ عَلَيْهِ أَنَّهُۥ مَن تَوَلَّاهُ فَأَنَّهُۥ يُضِلُّهُۥ وَيَهْدِيهِ إِلَىٰ عَذَابِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
englishTranslationText:
(The	 devil)	 Upon	 whom	 is	 decreed	 that	
whoever	 befriends	 him,	 he	 will	 certainly	
mislead	 him	 and	 show	 him	 the	 path	 to	
hell.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jispar	 likh	 diyā	 gayā	 hai	 ke	 jo	 uski	 dosti	
karegā	 to	 yeh	 zaroor	 usey	 gumrāh	
kardegā	aur	usey	‘Aƶāb-e-Dozakh		ki	rāh	batāyegā

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِن كُنتُمْ فِى رَيْبٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلْبَعْثِ فَإِنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰكُم مِّن تُرَابٍۢ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطْفَةٍۢ ثُمَّ مِنْ عَلَقَةٍۢ ثُمَّ مِن مُّضْغَةٍۢ مُّخَلَّقَةٍۢ وَغَيْرِ مُخَلَّقَةٍۢ لِّنُبَيِّنَ لَكُمْ ۚ وَنُقِرُّ فِى ٱلْأَرْحَامِ مَا نَشَآءُ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّۭى ثُمَّ نُخْرِجُكُمْ طِفْلًۭا ثُمَّ لِتَبْلُغُوٓا۟ أَشُدَّكُمْ ۖ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُتَوَفَّىٰ وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰٓ أَرْذَلِ ٱلْعُمُرِ لِكَيْلَا يَعْلَمَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ عِلْمٍۢ شَيْـًۭٔا ۚ وَتَرَى ٱلْأَرْضَ هَامِدَةًۭ فَإِذَآ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهَا ٱلْمَآءَ ٱهْتَزَّتْ وَرَبَتْ وَأَنۢبَتَتْ مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۭ بَهِيجٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
O	people,	if	you	doubt	your	revival	on	the	
Day	of	Resurrection,	then	ponder	that	We	
created	 you	 from	 dust,	 then	 from	a	 drop	
of	 liquid,	 then	 from	 a	 clot,	 then	 from	 a	
piece	of	flesh	formed	and	without	form,	so	that	We	show	you	Our	signs	for	you;	and	We	keep	
whomever	We	want	inside	 the	mothers’	wombs	up	 to	an	appointed	 time,	 then	extract	you	as	
infants,	then	in	order	that	you	reach	your	puberty;	and	among	you	is	one	who	dies	earlier,	and	
among	you	is	one	put	 to	 the	most	abject	age,	so	after	having	knowledge,	knows	nothing;	and	
you	 see	 the	 earth	 desolate,	 then	 when	 We	 sent	 down	 water	 upon	 it,	 it	 freshened	 up	 and	
developed	and	produced	beautiful	pairs	of	all	kinds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aye	logo!	Agar	tumheiñ	Qayāmat	ke	din	jeene	meiñ	kuch	shak	ho	to	yeh	ghaur	karo	ke	hamne	
tumheiñ	paidā	kiya	mitti	se		phir	pāni	ki	booñd	se	phir	khoon	ki	phatak	se	phir	gosht	ki	boti	se	
naqsha	 bani	 aur	 be-bani	 tāke	 Ham	 tumhāre	 liye apni	 nishāniyāñ	 zāhir	 farmāye	 aur	 ham	
thehrāye	rakhte	haiñ		māoñ	ke	pet	meiñ	jise	chāhe	ek	muqarrar	me’ād	tak	phir	tumheiñ	nikālte	
haiñ	bachcha	phir	isliye	ke	tum	apni	jawāni	ko	pahuñcho	aur	tum	meiñ	koi	pehle	hi	mar	jātā	hai	
aur	koi	sab	meiñ	nikammi	umr	tak	dālā	jātā	hai	Ke	jān-ne	ke	bād	kuch	na	jāne,	aur	tu	zameen	
ko	dekhe	murjhāyi	hui	phir	jab	hamne	uspar	pāni	utārā	tar-o-tāzāh	hui	aur	ubhar	āyi	aur	har	
raunaq	dār	jodā	ugā	lāyi

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَأَنَّهُۥ يُحْىِ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَأَنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
This	 is	 because	 Allah only	 is	 True	 and	
because	 He	 will	 revive	 the	 dead,	 and	
because	He	is	Able	to	do	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	is	liye	hai	ke	Allah	hi	Haq	hai	aur	yeh	
ke	 woh	 murde	 jilāye	 (zinda	 kare)	 gā	 aur	
yeh	ke	woh	sab	kuch	kar	saktā	hai

arabicText: وَأَنَّ ٱلسَّاعَةَ ءَاتِيَةٌۭ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهَا وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَبْعَثُ مَن فِى ٱلْقُبُورِ
englishTranslationText:
And	because	the	Last	Day	will	come,	there	
is	 no	 doubt	in	it	- and	 because	Allah will	
revive	those	who	are	in	the	graves
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 isliye	 ke	 Qayāmat	 āane	 wāli	 is	 meiñ	
kuch	 shak	 nahiñ,	 aur	 yeh	 ke	 Allah	
uthāyega	unheiñ	jo	qabroñ	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يُجَـٰدِلُ فِى ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍۢ وَلَا هُدًۭى وَلَا كِتَـٰبٍۢ مُّنِيرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	 there	 is	 one	 who	 argues	 concerning	
Allah without	 having	 knowledge	 nor	 any	
proof	nor	a	clear	text.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 koi	 ādmi	 woh	 hai	 ke	 Allah	 ke	 bāre	
meiñ	yuñ	jhagadta	hai	ke	na	to	‘ilm	na	koi	
daleel	 aur	 na	 Koi	 raushan	 nawishta	
(tehreer)

arabicText: ثَانِىَ عِطْفِهِۦ لِيُضِلَّ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ لَهُۥ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا خِزْىٌۭ ۖ وَنُذِيقُهُۥ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ عَذَابَ ٱلْحَرِيقِ
englishTranslationText:
With	his	neck	turned	away	from	the	truth,	
in	order	to	deceive	from	the	way	of	Allah;	
for	 him	 is	 disgrace	 in	 this	 world	 and	 on	
the	 Day	 of	 Resurrection	 We	 shall	 make	
him	taste	the	punishment	of	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Haq	se	apni	gardan	mode	huye	 tāki	Allah	
ki	 rāh	 se	 behkāde	 uske	 liye	 duniyā	 meiñ	
ruswāyi	hai	aur	Qayāmat	ke	din	ham	usey	
āg	ka	‘aƶāb	chakhāyeñge

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاكَ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَيْسَ بِظَلَّـٰمٍۢ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
“This	 is	 the	 recompense	 of	 what	 your	
hands	have	sent	ahead,	and	Allah does	not	
oppress	His	bondmen."
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	 uskā	 badlā	 hai	jo	 tere	 hāthoñ	 ne	āge	
bhejā	 aur	 Allah	 bandoñ	 par	 ƶulm	 nahiñ	
kartā

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَعْبُدُ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ حَرْفٍۢ ۖ فَإِنْ أَصَابَهُۥ خَيْرٌ ٱطْمَأَنَّ بِهِۦ ۖ وَإِنْ أَصَابَتْهُ فِتْنَةٌ ٱنقَلَبَ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِۦ خَسِرَ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةَ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلْخُسْرَانُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
englishTranslationText:
And	 there	 are	 some	 men	 who	 worship	
Allah upon	 an	 edge;	 then	 if	 some	 good	
occurs	 to	 them,	 they	 are	 content;	 and	 if	
some	 trial	 comes,	 they	 turn	 way	 upon	
their	 faces;	 a	 loss	 of	 this	 world	 and	 the	
Hereafter;	and	this	is	the	complete	loss.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kuch	Ādmi	Allah	ki	bandagi	ek	kināre	
par	 karte	 haiñ	 phir	 agar	 unheiñ	 koi	
bhalāyi	 ban	 gayi	jab	 to	 chain	 se	 haiñ	 aur	
jab	 koi	 Jāñch	 āa	 padi	 muñh	 ke	 bal	 palat
gaye,	 duniyā	 aur	 āakhirat	 dono	 ka	 ghātā	
yehi	hai	sareeh	nuqsān

arabicText: يَدْعُوا۟ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَضُرُّهُۥ وَمَا لَا يَنفَعُهُۥ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلضَّلَـٰلُ ٱلْبَعِيدُ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	ke	siwā	Aise	ko	poojte		haiñ	jo	unkā	
burā	bhalā	kuchh	na	kare	yehi	hai	door	ki	gumrāhi

arabicText: يَدْعُوا۟ لَمَن ضَرُّهُۥٓ أَقْرَبُ مِن نَّفْعِهِۦ ۚ لَبِئْسَ ٱلْمَوْلَىٰ وَلَبِئْسَ ٱلْعَشِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
They	 worship	 one	 from	 whom	 harm	 is	
expected	 more	 than	 the	 benefit;	 indeed	
what	an	evil	master	and	indeed	what	an	evil	friend!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aise	ko	poojte		haiñ	jiske	nafe	se	nuqsān	ki	tawaqqo	ziyādah	hai,	be-shak	kiya	hi	burā	maulā	aur	
be-shak	kiya	hi	burā	rafeeq

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُدْخِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَفْعَلُ مَا يُرِيدُ ١٤
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Allah will	admit	 those	who	believed	and	did	good	deeds,	into	Gardens	beneath	which	
rivers	flow;	indeed	Allah does	whatever	He	wills.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Allah	dākhil	karegā	unheiñ	jo	Imān	laye	aur	bhale	kām	kiye	bāghoñ	meiñ	jinke	neeche	
nehreiñ	rawāñ,	be-shak	Allah	kartā	hai	jo	chāhe

arabicText: مَن كَانَ يَظُنُّ أَن لَّن يَنصُرَهُ ٱللَّهُ فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ فَلْيَمْدُدْ بِسَبَبٍ إِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ ثُمَّ لْيَقْطَعْ فَلْيَنظُرْ هَلْ يُذْهِبَنَّ كَيْدُهُۥ مَا يَغِيظُ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	 whoever	 assumes	 that	 Allah will	 not	 assist	 His	 Prophet	(Muhammad - peace	 and	
blessings	be	upon	him)	in	this	world	and	the	Hereafter,	should	extend	a	rope	upwards	and	hang	
himself,	and	then	see	whether	his	scheme	has	taken	away	what	he	envies.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Jo	yeh	khayāl	kartā	ho	ke	Allah	apne	Nabi ki	madad	na	 farmāyegā	duniyā	aur	ākhirat	meiñ	to	
usey	 chāhiye	 ke	 upar	 ko	 ek	 rassi	 tāne	 phir	 apne	 āp	 ko	 phānsi	 de	le	 phir	 dekhe	 ke	 us	 ka	 yeh	
dāaoñ	kuch	le	gayā	us	bāt	ko	jiski	usey	jalan	hai

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ ءَايَـٰتٍۭ بَيِّنَـٰتٍۢ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَهْدِى مَن يُرِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
And	 so	 it	 is,	 that	 We	 sent	 down	 this	
Qur’an	 - clear	 verses	 - and	 that	 Allah
guides	whomever	He	wills.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 bāt	 yahi	 hai	 ke	 Hamne	 yeh	 Qur’ān	
utārā	 raushan	 Āyateiñ	 aur	 yeh	 ke	 Allah	
rāh	detā	hai	jise	chāhe.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱلَّذِينَ هَادُوا۟ وَٱلصَّـٰبِـِٔينَ وَٱلنَّصَـٰرَىٰ وَٱلْمَجُوسَ وَٱلَّذِينَ أَشْرَكُوٓا۟ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَفْصِلُ بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ شَهِيدٌ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed the	Muslims,	and	the	Jews,	and	the	
Sabeans,	 and	 the	 Christians	 and	 the	 fire	
worshippers	and	 the	 polytheists	- indeed	
Allah will	 decide	 between	 all	 of	 them	 on	
the	 Day	 of	 Resurrection;	 indeed	 Allah
witnesses	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Musalmān	aur	Yahūdi	aur	Sitārah	
Parast	 aur	 Nasrāni	 aur	 ātish	 parast	 aur	
mushrik,	be-shak	Allah	in	sab	me	Qayāmat	
ke	 din	 faisla kardegā	 be-shak	 har	 cheez	
Allah	ke	sāmne	hai

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَسْجُدُ لَهُۥ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱلشَّمْسُ وَٱلْقَمَرُ وَٱلنُّجُومُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ وَٱلشَّجَرُ وَٱلدَّوَآبُّ وَكَثِيرٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ ۖ وَكَثِيرٌ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۗ وَمَن يُهِنِ ٱللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن مُّكْرِمٍ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَفْعَلُ مَا يَشَآءُ ۩
englishTranslationText:
Did	 you	 not	 see	 that	 for	 Allah prostrate	
those	 who	 are	 in	 the	 heavens	 and	 in	 the	
earth,	and	the	sun,	and	the	moon,	and	the	
stars,	and	the	hills,	and	the	trees,	and	the	
beasts,	 and	 many	 among	 mankind;	 and	
there	 are	 many	 upon	 whom	 the	
punishment	 has	 been	 decreed;	 and	 he	
whom	 Allah disgraces	 - there	 is	 none	 to	
give	 him	 honour;	 indeed	 Allah may	 do	
whatever	 He	 wills.	 (Command	 of	
Prostration	#	6)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	 tumne	 na	 dekhā?	 Ke	 Allah	 ke	 liye	
Sajda karte	 haiñ	 woh	 jo	 āsmānon	 aur	
zameenoñ	meiñ	 haiñ	aur	 suraj	aur	 chāñd	
aur	 tāre	 aur	 pahād	 aur	 darakht	 aur	
chaupāye	aur	bahut	ādmi,	aur	bahut	woh	
hai	 jinpar	 ‘aƶāb	 muqarrar	 ho	 chukā	 aur	
jise	 Allah	 zaleel	 kare	 usey	 koi	 izzat	 dene		
wāla	 nahiñ,	 be-shak	 Allah	 jo chāhe	 kare.	
(Sajde ka	Hukm	#6)

arabicText: يُصْهَرُ بِهِۦ مَا فِى بُطُونِهِمْ وَٱلْجُلُودُ
englishTranslationText:
With	 which	 will	 melt	 what	 is	 in	 their	
bellies,	and	their	skins.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	se	gal	jayegā	jo	kuchh	in	ke	petoñ	meiñ	hai	aur	unki	khāleiñ

arabicText: وَلَهُم مَّقَـٰمِعُ مِنْ حَدِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	for	them	are	rods	of	iron.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	unke	liye	lohe	ke	gurz	haiñ

arabicText: كُلَّمَآ أَرَادُوٓا۟ أَن يَخْرُجُوا۟ مِنْهَا مِنْ غَمٍّ أُعِيدُوا۟ فِيهَا وَذُوقُوا۟ عَذَابَ ٱلْحَرِيقِ
englishTranslationText:
Whenever	they	wish	to	come	out	of	it	due	to	suffocation,	they	will	be	returned	to	it	again	and	it	
will	be	commanded,	“Taste	the punishment	of	fire!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	ghutan	ke	sabab	us	me	se	nikalnā	chāheiñge	phir	Us	meiñ	lautā	diye	jāyeñge	aur	hukm	hogā	
ke	chakho	āag	ka	‘aƶāb

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُدْخِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ يُحَلَّوْنَ فِيهَا مِنْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٍۢ وَلُؤْلُؤًۭا ۖ وَلِبَاسُهُمْ فِيهَا حَرِيرٌۭ ٢٣
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Allah will	 admit	 those	who	 believed	 and	 did	good	 deeds	into	 Gardens	 beneath	which	
rivers	flow	- in	it	they	will	be	made	to	wear	armlets	of	gold,	and	pearls,	and	in	it	their	garment	is	
silk.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Allah	dākhil	karegā	unheiñ	jo	Imān	laye	aur	acche	kām	kiye	beheshtoñ	meiñ	jinke	niche	
nehreiñ	 baheiñ	 us	 meiñ	 pehnāye	 jayeñge	 sone	 ke	 kangan	 aur	 moti	 aur	 wahāñ	 unki	 poshāk	
resham	hai

arabicText: وَهُدُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلطَّيِّبِ مِنَ ٱلْقَوْلِ وَهُدُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْحَمِيدِ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unheiñ	pākeeza	bāt	ki	hidāyat	ki	gayi	
aur	sab	khubiyoñ	sarāhe	ki	rāh	batāyi	gayi

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلْنَـٰهُ لِلنَّاسِ سَوَآءً ٱلْعَـٰكِفُ فِيهِ وَٱلْبَادِ ۚ وَمَن يُرِدْ فِيهِ بِإِلْحَادٍۭ بِظُلْمٍۢ نُّذِقْهُ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 those	 who	 have	 disbelieved	 and	
prevent	 from	 the	 way	 of	 Allah and	 from	
this	 Sacred	 Masjid,	 which	 We	 have	
appointed	 for	 all	 mankind	 – its	 resident	
and	the	 foreigner	have	the	same	rights	in	
it;	 and	 whoever	 wrongfully	 intends	
injustice	in	it	- We	shall	make	him	taste	a	
painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	 woh	 jinhoñ	 ne	 kufr	 kiya	 aur	
roñkte	haiñ	Allah	ki	rāh	aur	us	adab	wāli	
Masjid	 se	 jise	 Hamne	 sab	 logo	 ke	 liye	
muqarrar	 kiya	 ke	 us	 meiñ	 ek	 sā	 haq	 hai	
Wahāñ	ke	Rahne	wāle	aur	pardesi	ka	aur	
jo	 is	 meiñ	 Kisi	 ziyādati	 ka	 nā-haq	 irāda	
kare	 ham	 usey	 dard-nāk	 ‘aƶāb	
chakhāyeñge

arabicText: وَإِذْ بَوَّأْنَا لِإِبْرَٰهِيمَ مَكَانَ ٱلْبَيْتِ أَن لَّا تُشْرِكْ بِى شَيْـًۭٔا وَطَهِّرْ بَيْتِىَ لِلطَّآئِفِينَ وَٱلْقَآئِمِينَ وَٱلرُّكَّعِ ٱلسُّجُودِ
englishTranslationText:
. And	remember	when	We	showed	Ibrahim	
the	 right	 place	 of	 the	 Sacred	 House	
(masjid)	 and	 commanded	 that,	 “Do	 not	
ascribe	 anything	 as	 a	 partner	 to	 Me,	 and	
keep	 My	 House	 clean	 for	 those	 who	
encircle	 it	 and	 those	 who	 stay	 in	 it	 (for	
worship)	 and	 those	 who	 bow	 and
prostrate.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	 ke	Hamne	Ibrāhim ko	 us	ghar	 ka	
thikāna	 thik	 batā	 diyā	 aur	 hukm	 diyā	 ke	
merā	 koi	 shareek	 na	 kar	 aur	 merā	 ghar	
suthrā	 rakhe	 tawāf	 wāloñ	 aur	 e’atikāf	
wāloñ	aur	Ruku’	Sajde	wāloñ	ke	liye

arabicText: وَأَذِّن فِى ٱلنَّاسِ بِٱلْحَجِّ يَأْتُوكَ رِجَالًۭا وَعَلَىٰ كُلِّ ضَامِرٍۢ يَأْتِينَ مِن كُلِّ فَجٍّ عَمِيقٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“And	publicly	announce	the	pilgrimage	to	
all	people	– they	will	come	to	you,	on	foot	
and	on	every	lean	she-camel,	coming	from	
every	 far	 distant	 journey.”	 (The	
announcement	 by	 Prophet	 Ibrahim	
reached	each	and	every	soul.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 logo	 me	 Haj	 ki	 āam	 nidā	 karde	 woh	
tere	pās	hāzir	hoñge	piyādah	aur	har	dubli	
Oñtni	par	ke	har	door	ki	rāh	se	āati	haiñ

arabicText: لِّيَشْهَدُوا۟ مَنَـٰفِعَ لَهُمْ وَيَذْكُرُوا۟ ٱسْمَ ٱللَّهِ فِىٓ أَيَّامٍۢ مَّعْلُومَـٰتٍ عَلَىٰ مَا رَزَقَهُم مِّنۢ بَهِيمَةِ ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ ۖ فَكُلُوا۟ مِنْهَا وَأَطْعِمُوا۟ ٱلْبَآئِسَ ٱلْفَقِيرَ
englishTranslationText:
In	order	 that	 they	may	gain	 their	benefit,	
and	mention	 the	name	 of	Allah on	 the	appointed	days	as	He	 has	 bestowed	 the	 sustenance	 to	
them	 – the	 inarticulate	 animals;	 therefore	 eat	 from	 them	 yourself	 and	 feed	 the	 distressed	
destitute.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tāke	woh	apnā	fāyda	pāyeiñ	aur	Allah	ka	nām	leiñ	jāne	huye	dinoñ	meiñ	ispar	ke	unheiñ	rozi	di	
be-zabān	chaupāye	to	un	meiñ	se	khud	khāo	aur	musibat	zada	mohtāj	ko	khilāo

arabicText: ثُمَّ لْيَقْضُوا۟ تَفَثَهُمْ وَلْيُوفُوا۟ نُذُورَهُمْ وَلْيَطَّوَّفُوا۟ بِٱلْبَيْتِ ٱلْعَتِيقِ
englishTranslationText: They	must	then	remove	their	dirt	and	fulfil	their	pledges	and	go	around	the	Free	House.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	apnā	mail	kuchail	utāreiñ	aur	apni	mannateiñ	puri	kareñ	aur	is	āzād	ghar	ka	tawāf	kareiñ

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ وَمَن يُعَظِّمْ حُرُمَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَهُوَ خَيْرٌۭ لَّهُۥ عِندَ رَبِّهِۦ ۗ وَأُحِلَّتْ لَكُمُ ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمُ إِلَّا مَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَٱجْتَنِبُوا۟ ٱلرِّجْسَ مِنَ ٱلْأَوْثَـٰنِ وَٱجْتَنِبُوا۟ قَوْلَ ٱلزُّورِ
englishTranslationText:
So	it	is;	and	whoever	reveres	the	sacred	things	of	Allah – that	is	then	a	goodness	for	him	in	the	
sight	of	his	Lord;	the	inarticulate	animals	are	lawful	to	you	except	those	the	forbidding	of	which	
is	recited	to	you,	therefore	shun	the	filth	of	idols,	and	avoid	false	speech.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bāt	yeh	hai	aur	jo	Allah	ki	hurmatoñ	ki	t’āzeem	kare	to	woh	iske	liye	uske	Rab	ke	yahāñ	bhalā	
hai,	aur	tumhāre	liye	halāl	kiye	gaye	be-zabān	chaupāye	siwā	unke	jinki	mumān’at	tum	par	padi	
jāti	hai	to	door	ho	butoñ	ki	gandagi	se	aur	bacho	jhooti	bāt	se.

arabicText: حُنَفَآءَ لِلَّهِ غَيْرَ مُشْرِكِينَ بِهِۦ ۚ وَمَن يُشْرِكْ بِٱللَّهِ فَكَأَنَّمَا خَرَّ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ فَتَخْطَفُهُ ٱلطَّيْرُ أَوْ تَهْوِى بِهِ ٱلرِّيحُ فِى مَكَانٍۢ سَحِيقٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Devoting	yourself	to	Allah,	not	ascribing	
any	 partner	 to	 Him;	 and	 whoever	
ascribes	partners	to	Allah is	as	if	he	has	
fallen	from	the	sky	and	the	birds	snatch	
him	 or	 the	 wind	 blows	 him	 away	 to	 a	
far-off	place.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ek	 Allah	 ke	 hokar	 ke	 uskā	 sājhi	
(shareek)	kisi	ko	na	karo	aur	jo	Allah	ka	
shareek	 kare	 woh	 goyā	 girā	 āasmān	 se	
ke	 parinde	 usey	 uchak	 le	 jāte	 haiñ	 ya	
hawā	usey	kisi	door	jagāh	pheñkti	hai

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ وَمَن يُعَظِّمْ شَعَـٰٓئِرَ ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّهَا مِن تَقْوَى ٱلْقُلُوبِ
englishTranslationText:
So	 it	 is;	 and	 whoever	 reveres	 the	
symbols	of	Allah – this	is	then	part	of	the	
piety	of	the	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bāt	 yeh	 hai	 aur	jo	 Allah	 ke	 nishānoñ	 ki	
t’āzeem	kare	to	yeh	diloñ	ki parhez-gāri	
se	haiai

arabicText: لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَنَـٰفِعُ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّۭى ثُمَّ مَحِلُّهَآ إِلَى ٱلْبَيْتِ ٱلْعَتِيقِ
englishTranslationText:
. In	the	cattle	are	benefits	for	you	up	to	a	
fixed	 time	 and	 then	 they	 are	 to	 be	
brought	to	the	Free	House.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumhāre	 liye	 chaupāyoñ	 meiñ	 fāyde	
haiñ	 ek	 muqarrar	 me’ād	 tak	 phir	 unkā	
pahuñchnā	hai	us	āzād	ghar	tak

arabicText: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍۢ جَعَلْنَا مَنسَكًۭا لِّيَذْكُرُوا۟ ٱسْمَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَىٰ مَا رَزَقَهُم مِّنۢ بَهِيمَةِ ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ ۗ فَإِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ فَلَهُۥٓ أَسْلِمُوا۟ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلْمُخْبِتِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	for	every	nation	We	have	appointed	
a	 sacrifice,	 that	 they	 may	 mention	 the	
name	 of	 Allah over the	 inarticulate	
animal	which	He	has	provided	 them;	so	
(remember)	 your	 God	 is	 One	 God,	
therefore	 submit	 only	 to	 Him;	 and	 give	
glad	tidings	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad
- peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	to	the	
humble.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 har	 Ummat	 ke	 liye	 Hamne	 ek	
qurbāni	 muqarrar	 farmāyi	 ke	 Allal	 ka	
Nām	 leiñ	 Uske	 diye	 huye	 be-zabān	
chaupāyoñ	 par	 to	 tumhārā	 m’ābood ek	
m’ābood	 hai	 to	 usi	 ke	 huzoor	 gardan	
rakho	aur	aey	Mehboob!	Khushi	sunā	do	
un	tawāzo’	wāloñ	ko

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِرَ ٱللَّهُ وَجِلَتْ قُلُوبُهُمْ وَٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ عَلَىٰ مَآ أَصَابَهُمْ وَٱلْمُقِيمِى ٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَـٰهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 whose	 hearts	 fear	 when	 Allah is	
mentioned,	 and	 those	 who	 patiently	
endure	 whatever	 befalls	 them,	 and	
those	 who	 keep	 the	 prayer	 established,	
and	 who	 spend	 part	 of	 what	 We	 have	
provided	to	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	 jab	 Allah	 ka	 Ƶikr	 hotā	 hai	 Unke	 dil	
Darne	lagte	haiñ	aur	jo	uftād	pade	Uske	
sehne	 wāle	 aur	 Namāz	 barpā	 (Qāyem)	
rakhne	wāle	aur	Hamāre	diye	se	kharch	
karte haiñ	.

arabicText: وَٱلْبُدْنَ جَعَلْنَـٰهَا لَكُم مِّن شَعَـٰٓئِرِ ٱللَّهِ لَكُمْ فِيهَا خَيْرٌۭ ۖ فَٱذْكُرُوا۟ ٱسْمَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيْهَا صَوَآفَّ ۖ فَإِذَا وَجَبَتْ جُنُوبُهَا فَكُلُوا۟ مِنْهَا وَأَطْعِمُوا۟ ٱلْقَانِعَ وَٱلْمُعْتَرَّ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ سَخَّرْنَـٰهَا لَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 large	 sacrificial	 animals	 – the	
camels	 and	 the	 cows	 - We	 have	 made	
them	 among	 the	 symbols	 of	Allah,	 there	is	 goodness	 for	 you	in	 them;	 therefore	mention	 the	
name	 of	Allah over	 them	with	 their	 one	leg	 tied	and	 standing	 on	 three	 feet;	 then	when	 their
flanks	have	 fallen,	eat	 from	it	yourself	and	 feed	the	one	who	patiently	awaits,	and	the	beggar;	
this	is	how	We	have	given	them	in	your	control,	so	that	you	be	grateful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Qurbāni	 ke	 dealdār	 (bhāri	 jasāmat	
wāle)	jānwar	Oñt	aur	gāyeñ	hamne	tumhāre	liye	Allah	ki	nishāniyoñ	se	kiye	tumhāre	liye	unme	
bhalāyi	 hai	 to	 unpar	 Allah	 ka	 nām	 lo	 ek	 pāoñ	 bañdhe	 teen	 pāoñ	 se	 khade	 phir	 jab	 unki	
karwateiñ	gir	jāyeiñ	to	unme	se	khud	khāo	aur	Sabr	se	baithne	wāle	aur	bheek	māñgne	wāle	ko	
khilāo,	Hamne	yuñhi	unko	tumhāre	bas	me	de	diyā	ke	tum	Ehsān māno.

arabicText: لَن يَنَالَ ٱللَّهَ لُحُومُهَا وَلَا دِمَآؤُهَا وَلَـٰكِن يَنَالُهُ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ مِنكُمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ سَخَّرَهَا لَكُمْ لِتُكَبِّرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ مَا هَدَىٰكُمْ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Never	does	their	flesh	nor	their	blood	reach	Allah,	but	your	piety	successfully	reaches	Him;	this	
is	 how	We	 have	given	 them	in	 your	 control	 so	 that	 you	may	 speak	His	Greatness	 for	guiding	
you;	and	O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	give	glad	tidings	to	the	
virtuous
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	ko	har-giz	na	unke	gosht	pahuñchte	haiñ	na	unke	khoon	hāñ	tumhāri	Parhez-gāri	us	tak	
bāryāb	hoti	hai	yuñhi	unko	tumhāre	bas	me	kardiyā	ke	tum	Allah	ki	badāyi	bolo	ispar	ke	tum	ko	
hidāyat		farmāyi	aur	aye	Mehboob khush-khabri	sunāo	Neki	wāloñ	ko

arabicText: ۞ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُدَٰفِعُ عَنِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ خَوَّانٍۢ كَفُورٍ
englishTranslationText:
. Indeed	 Allah repels	 the	 afflictions	 of	 the	 Muslims;	 indeed	 Allah does	 not	 like	 any	 extremely	
disloyal	ingrate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	 Allah	 balāyeiñ	 tālta hai	 Musalmānoñ	 ki	 be-shak	 Allah	 dost	 nahiñ	 rakhtā	 har	 bade	
daghābāz	na-shukre	ko

arabicText: أُذِنَ لِلَّذِينَ يُقَـٰتَلُونَ بِأَنَّهُمْ ظُلِمُوا۟ ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ نَصْرِهِمْ لَقَدِيرٌ
englishTranslationText:
Permission	 is	 granted	 to	 those	 against	
whom	 the	disbelievers	wage	war,	as	 they	
are	 being	 wronged;	 and	 indeed	 Allah is	
Able	to	assist	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Parwāngi	 (ijāzat)	 át’ā	 hui	 unheiñ	 jin	 se	
kāfir	ladte	haiñ	is	binā	par	ke	unpar	ƶulm	
huā	 aur	 be-shak	 Allah	 unki	 Madad	 karne	
par	zaroor	Qādir	hai.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ أُخْرِجُوا۟ مِن دِيَـٰرِهِم بِغَيْرِ حَقٍّ إِلَّآ أَن يَقُولُوا۟ رَبُّنَا ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَلَوْلَا دَفْعُ ٱللَّهِ ٱلنَّاسَ بَعْضَهُم بِبَعْضٍۢ لَّهُدِّمَتْ صَوَٰمِعُ وَبِيَعٌۭ وَصَلَوَٰتٌۭ وَمَسَـٰجِدُ يُذْكَرُ فِيهَا ٱسْمُ ٱللَّهِ كَثِيرًۭا ۗ وَلَيَنصُرَنَّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَنصُرُهُۥٓ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَقَوِىٌّ عَزِيزٌ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 who	 were	 unjustly	 expelled	 from	
their	homes	just	because	they	said,	“Allah
is	 Our	 Lord”;	 and	 had	 Allah not	 repelled	
some	 men	 by	 means	 of	 other	 men,	 the	
abbeys,	churches,	synagogues	and	masjids	
- in	which	 the	 name	 of	Allah is	 profusely	
mentioned	 - would	 definitely	 be	
demolished;	 and	 indeed	 Allah will	 assist	
the	 one	 who	 helps	 His	 religion;	 indeed	
surely	Allah is	Almighty,	Dominant
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jo	apne	gharoñ	se	na-haq	nikāle	gaye	
sirf	itni	bāt	par	ke	unhoñ	ne	kahā	hamārā	
Rab	 Allah	 hai	 aur	 Allah	 agar	 ādmiyoñ	
meiñ	 ek	 ko	 dusre	 se	 Daf’ā	 na	 farmātā	 to	
zaroor	 dhā	 di	jātiñ	 khān	 kāheiñ	 aur	 girjā	
aur	kalisā	aur	Masjideiñ	jin	meiñ	Allah	ka	
ba-kasrat	 nām	 liyā	 jātā	 hai	 aur	 be-shak	
Allah	 zaroor	 madad	 farmāyegā uski	 jo	
uske	Deen	ki	madad	kare	be-shak		zaroor	
Allah	Qudrat		wāla	ghālib	hai.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ إِن مَّكَّنَّـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ أَقَامُوا۟ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتَوُا۟ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَمَرُوا۟ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَنَهَوْا۟ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ ۗ وَلِلَّهِ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْأُمُورِ
englishTranslationText:
The	 people	who,	if	We	give	 them	 control	
in	 the	 land,	 would	 keep	 the	 prayer	
established	 and	 pay	 charity	 and	 enjoin	
virtue	and	 forbid	 from	evil;	and	 for	Allah
only	is	the	result	of	all	works.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	log	ke	agar	ham	unheiñ	zameen	meiñ	
qābu	 deiñ	 to	 Namāz	 barpā	 rakheiñ	 aur	
Zakāt	deiñ	aur	bhalāyi	ka	hukm	kareiñ	aur	
burāyi	 se	 rokeiñ	 aur	 Allah	 hi	 ke	 liye	 sab	
kāmoñ	ka	anjām

arabicText: وَإِن يُكَذِّبُوكَ فَقَدْ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍۢ وَعَادٌۭ وَثَمُودُ
englishTranslationText:
If	 they	 belie	 you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him),	then	indeed	the	people	of	Nooh,	and	
the	tribes	of	A’ad	and	Thamud	have	belied	
before	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	yeh	tumhāri	 takzeeb	karte	haiñ	 to	be-shak	unse	pehle	jhutlā	chuki	hai	Nūh ki	Qaom	
aur	‘Āad	aur	Samood

arabicText: وَقَوْمُ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَقَوْمُ لُوطٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	(so	did)	the	people	of	Ibrahim	and	the	
people	of	Lut.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Ibrāhim ki	Qaom	aur	Lūt ki	Qaom

arabicText: وَأَصْحَـٰبُ مَدْيَنَ ۖ وَكُذِّبَ مُوسَىٰ فَأَمْلَيْتُ لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُهُمْ ۖ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	people	of	Madyan;	and	Moosa	was	belied,	so	 I	gave	 the	disbelievers	respite	and	 then
seized	them;	so	how	(dreadful)	was	My	punishment!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Madyan	wāle	aur	Mūsā ki	takzeeb	hui	to	maiñ	ne	kāfiroñ	ko	dheel	di	phir	unheiñ	pakdā	to	
kaisā	huā	merā	ázāb

arabicText: فَكَأَيِّن مِّن قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهَا وَهِىَ ظَالِمَةٌۭ فَهِىَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا وَبِئْرٍۢ مُّعَطَّلَةٍۢ وَقَصْرٍۢ مَّشِيدٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	many	a	township	did	We	destroy,	for	they	were	oppressors	– so	they	now	lie	flat	on	their	
roofs,	and	many	a	well	lying	useless	and	many	a	palace	in	ruins.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kitni	 hi	 bastiyāñ	 hamne	 khapā	 deiñ	 	 ke	 woh	 sitamgār	 theiñ	 to	 ab	 woh	 apni chhatoñ	 par	
dhayi	(giri)	padi	haiñ	aur	kitne	kuñweiñ	bekār	pade	aur	kitne	mahel	gach	kiye huye

arabicText: أَفَلَمْ يَسِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَتَكُونَ لَهُمْ قُلُوبٌۭ يَعْقِلُونَ بِهَآ أَوْ ءَاذَانٌۭ يَسْمَعُونَ بِهَا ۖ فَإِنَّهَا لَا تَعْمَى ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرُ وَلَـٰكِن تَعْمَى ٱلْقُلُوبُ ٱلَّتِى فِى ٱلصُّدُورِ
englishTranslationText:
So	have	they	not	travelled	in	the	land,	to	have	hearts	with	which	to	understand	and	ears	to	hear	
with?	So	it	is	not	the	eyes	that	are	blind,	but	it	is	the	hearts	in	the	bosoms,	that	are	blind.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	kya	zameen	meiñ	na	chale	ke	unke	dil	hoñ	jinse	samjheiñ	ya	kān	hoñ	jinse	suneiñ	to	yeh	ke	
āñkheñ	andhi	nahiñ	hotiñ	balke	woh	dil	andhe	hote	haiñ	jo	seenoñ	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: وَيَسْتَعْجِلُونَكَ بِٱلْعَذَابِ وَلَن يُخْلِفَ ٱللَّهُ وَعْدَهُۥ ۚ وَإِنَّ يَوْمًا عِندَ رَبِّكَ كَأَلْفِ سَنَةٍۢ مِّمَّا تَعُدُّونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 ask	 you	 for	 the	 punishment	 –
they	 are	 impatient	 – and	 Allah will	 not	
make	 His	 promise	 untrue;	 and	 indeed	 a	
single	day	before	Allah is	like	a	 thousand	
years	in	your	calculation.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kitni	 bastiyāñ	 ke	Hamne	 unko	 dheel	
di	 is	 hāl	 par	 ke	 woh	 sitamgār	 theiñ	 phir	
maiñ	 ne	 unheiñ	 pakdā	 aur	 meri	 hi	 taraf	
palat	kar	āanā	haiñ

arabicText: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن قَرْيَةٍ أَمْلَيْتُ لَهَا وَهِىَ ظَالِمَةٌۭ ثُمَّ أَخَذْتُهَا وَإِلَىَّ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	many	a	township	did	I	give	respite	
although	 they	 were	 oppressors;	 then	 I	
seized	 them;	 and	 towards	 Me	 is	 the	
return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kitni	 bastiyāñ	 ke	Hamne	 unko	 dheel	
di	 is	 hāl	 par	 ke	 woh	 sitamgār	 theiñ	 phir	
maiñ	 ne	 unheiñ	 pakdā	 aur	 meri	 hi	 taraf	
palat	kar	āanā	haiñ

arabicText: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	“O	mankind,	I	am	for	you	only	a	
clear	Herald	of	Warning.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 farmā	 do	 ke	aye	logo!	Maiñ	 to	ye-hi	
tumhāre	liye	sareeh	dar	sunāne		wāla	huñ

arabicText: فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌۭ وَرِزْقٌۭ كَرِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
So	 those	 who	 believed	 and	 did	 good	
deeds,	 for	 them	 are	 forgiveness,	 and	 an	
excellent	sustenance.	So	 those	 who	 believed	 and	 did	 good	
deeds,	 for	 them	 are	 forgiveness,	 and	 an	
excellent	sustenance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 jo	 Imān	 layeiñ	 aur	 achche	 kām	 kiye	
unke	liye	bakshish	hai	aur	izzat	ki	rozi

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ سَعَوْا۟ فِىٓ ءَايَـٰتِنَا مُعَـٰجِزِينَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
And	 those	 who	 strive	 in	 Our	 signs	 with	
the	intention	 of	 disputing,	are	 the	 people	
of	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 woh	 jo	 koshish	 karte	 haiñ	 Hamāri	
Āyatoñ	 meiñ	 hār	 jeet	 ke	 irāde	 se	 woh	
Jahannami	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ مِن رَّسُولٍۢ وَلَا نَبِىٍّ إِلَّآ إِذَا تَمَنَّىٰٓ أَلْقَى ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ فِىٓ أُمْنِيَّتِهِۦ فَيَنسَخُ ٱللَّهُ مَا يُلْقِى ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ ثُمَّ يُحْكِمُ ٱللَّهُ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	all	the	Noble	Messengers	or	Prophets	
whom	 We	 sent	 before	 you	 – it	 occurred	
with	 all	 of	 them	 – that	 whenever	 they	
recited	(the	message)	Satan	included	a	bit	
(from	his	own	speech)	in	their	recitation	to	
the	 people;	 so	 Allah obliterates	 what	
Satan	includes	and	then	Allah fortifies	His	
verses;	and	Allah is	All	Knowing,	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hamne	 tum	 se	 pehle	 jitne	 Rasool	 ya	
Nabi bheje	 sab	 par	 kabhi	 yeh	 wāqiyāh	
guzrā	 hai	 ke	 jab	 unhoñ	 ne	 padhā	 to	
shaitān	 ne	 unke	 padhne	 meiñ	 logoñ	 par	
kuchh	apni	taraf	se	milā	diyā	to	mitā	detā	
hai	Allah	 us	 shaitān	 ke	 dāle	 huye	 ko	 phir	
Allah	apni	Āayateiñ	pakki	kar	detā	hai	aur	
Allah	‘Ilm-o-Hikmat		wāla	hai

arabicText: لِّيَجْعَلَ مَا يُلْقِى ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ فِتْنَةًۭ لِّلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌۭ وَٱلْقَاسِيَةِ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ لَفِى شِقَاقٍۭ بَعِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	 that	 He	 may	 make	 what	 the	 devil	
includes	a	 trial	 for	 those	in	whose	hearts	
is	 a	 disease,	 and	 those	 whose	 hearts	 are	 hardened;	 indeed	 the	 unjust	 are	 extremely	
quarrelsome.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tāke	shaitān	ke	dāle	huye	ko	 fitna	kardeiñ	unke	liye	jinke	diloñ	meiñ	bimāri	hai	aur	jinke	dil	
sakht	haiñ	aur	be-shak	sitamgār	dhur	(Intehāyi	Sakht)	ke	jhagdālu	haiñ	.

arabicText: وَلِيَعْلَمَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْعِلْمَ أَنَّهُ ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ فَيُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِهِۦ فَتُخْبِتَ لَهُۥ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَهَادِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٍۢ مُّسْتَقِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	so	 that	 the	people	given	 the	knowledge	may	know	 that	it	is	 the	 truth	 from	your	Lord,	in	
order	 that	 they	 may	 accept	 faith	 in	 it,	 therefore	 their	 hearts	 may	 humble	 before	 Him;	 and	
indeed	Allah will	guide	the	believers	on	the	Straight	Path.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	isliye	ke	jān	leiñ	woh	jinko	‘ilm	milā	hai	ke	woh	 tumhāre	Rab	ke	pās	se	Haq	hai	 to	uspar	
Imān	 layeiñ	 to	 jhuk	 jāyeiñ uske	 liye	 unke	 dil	 aur	 be-shak	 Allah	 Imān	 wāloñ	 ko	 seedhi	 rāh	
chalāne	wāla	hai

arabicText: وَلَا يَزَالُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِى مِرْيَةٍۢ مِّنْهُ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ ٱلسَّاعَةُ بَغْتَةً أَوْ يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَقِيمٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	disbelievers	will	always	be	in	doubt	of	it,	to	the	extent	that	the	Last	Day	will	suddenly	
come	upon	them,	or	will	come	upon	them	the	punishment	of	a	day	the	result	of	which	is	not	at	
all	good	for	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur kāfir	us-se	hamesha	shak	meiñ	rakheiñ-ge	yahāñ	tak	ke	unpar	Qayāmat	āa	jāye	achānak	yā	
unpar	aise	din	ka	‘aƶāb	āaye	jiskā	phal	Unke	liye	kuch	achchā	na	ho.

arabicText: ٱلْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ لِّلَّهِ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فِى جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
For	Allah only	is	the	kingship	on	that	day;	
He	will	judge	between	them;	so	those	who	
believed	 and	 did	 good	 deeds	 are	 in	
Gardens	of	content.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bādshāhi	 us	 din	 Allah	 hi	 ki	 hai	 woh	 unmeiñ	 faisla	 kardegā	 to	 jo	 Imān	 lāye	 aur	
achche	 kām	 kiye	 woh	 chain	 ke bāghoñ	
meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَكَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌۭ مُّهِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 those	 who	 disbelieved	 and	 denied	
Our	signs	- for	 them	will	be	a	disgraceful	
punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jinhoñ	 ne	 Kufr	 kiya	 aur	 Hamāri	
Āyateiñ	 jhutlāiñ	 unke	 liye	 zillat	 ka	 ‘aƶāb	
haiñ

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ثُمَّ قُتِلُوٓا۟ أَوْ مَاتُوا۟ لَيَرْزُقَنَّهُمُ ٱللَّهُ رِزْقًا حَسَنًۭا ۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 those	 who	 left	 their	 homes	 and	
belongings	in	Allah's	cause	and	were	then	
killed	or	died	- Allah will	therefore	indeed	
provide	for	them	an	excellent	sustenance;	
and	 indeed	 the	 sustenance	 bestowed	 by	
Allah is	the	best.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jinhoñ	ne	Allah	ki	rāh	meiñ	apne	
ghar	 bār	 chorde	 phir	 māre	 gaye	 ya	 mar	
gaye	 to	 Allah	 zaroor	 unheiñ	 achchi	 rozi	
degā	 aur	 be-shak	 Allah	 ki	 rozi	 sabse	
behtar	hai

arabicText: لَيُدْخِلَنَّهُم مُّدْخَلًۭا يَرْضَوْنَهُۥ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلِيمٌ حَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
He	 will	 certainly	 admit	 them	 to	 a	 place	
they	 will	 love;	 and	 indeed	 Allah is	 All	
Knowing,	Most	Forbearing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Zaroor	unheiñ	aisi	jagāh	le	jāyegā	jise	woh	
pasand	kareiñge	aur	be-shak	Allah Ílm	aur	
hilm		wāla	hai

arabicText: ۞ ذَٰلِكَ وَمَنْ عَاقَبَ بِمِثْلِ مَا عُوقِبَ بِهِۦ ثُمَّ بُغِىَ عَلَيْهِ لَيَنصُرَنَّهُ ٱللَّهُ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَعَفُوٌّ غَفُورٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
So	 it	 is;	 and	 whoever	 retaliates	 similarly	
to	 the	 affliction	 he	 was	 made	 to	 suffer,	
and	 then	 he	 is	 wronged	 again	 – so	Allah
will	 definitely	 assist	 him;	 indeed	Allah is	
Oft	Pardoning,	Oft	Forgiving.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bāt	 yeh	 hai	 aur	 jo	 badlā	 leiñ	 jaisi	 takleef	
pahuñchāyi	gayi	thi	phir	uspar	ziyādati	ki	
jāye	 to	 be-shak	 Allah uski	 madad	
farmāyegā	 be-shak	 Allah	 mu’āf	 karne		
wāla	bakhsh ne	wāla	hai.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُولِجُ ٱلَّيْلَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِى ٱلَّيْلِ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌۢ بَصِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	because	Allah inserts	the	night	into	
a	part	of	the	day	and	inserts	the	day	into	a	
part	of	the	night,	and	because	Allah is	All	Hearing,	All	Seeing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	is-liye	ke	Allah	t’ālā	rāt	ko	dāltā	hai	din	ke	hisse	meiñ	aur	din	ko	lātā	hai	rāt	ke	hisse	meiñ	
aur	is-liye	ke	Allah	suntā	dekhtā	hai

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَأَنَّ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ هُوَ ٱلْبَـٰطِلُ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْعَلِىُّ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
This	 is	 because	 Allah only	 is	 the	 Truth,	 and	 what	 they	 worship	 other	 than	 Him,	 is	 itself	
falsehood,	and	because	Allah only	is	the	Supreme,	the	Great.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	Is-liye	ke	Allah	hi	Haq	hai	aur	iske	siwā	jise	poojte	haiñ	wahi	bātil	haiñ	aur	is-liye	ke	Allah	
hi	bulandi	badāyi wāla	hai.

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ فَتُصْبِحُ ٱلْأَرْضُ مُخْضَرَّةً ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَطِيفٌ خَبِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	that	Allah sent	down	water	from	the	sky,	so	the	earth	became	green	at	morn?	
Indeed	Allah is	Pure,	Aware.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tu	ne	na	dekhā	ke	Allah	ne	āsmānoñ	se	pāni	utārā	aur	subah	ko	zameen	haryāli	(Hari	Bhari)	
ho	gayi	be-shak	Allah	Pāk	khabardār	hai.

arabicText: لَّهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَهُوَ ٱلْغَنِىُّ ٱلْحَمِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
To	Him	only	belongs	all	that	is	in	the	heavens	and	all	that	is	in	the	earth;	and	indeed	Allah only	
is	the	Perfect	(Not	Needing	Anything),	the	Most	Praiseworthy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Usi	kā	māl	hai	jo	kuchh	āsmānoñ	meiñ	hai	aur	jo	kuch	zameenoñ	meiñ	hai	aur	be-shak	Allah	hi	
be-niyāz	sab	khubiyoñ	sarāhā	hai

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُم مَّا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱلْفُلْكَ تَجْرِى فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ بِأَمْرِهِۦ وَيُمْسِكُ ٱلسَّمَآءَ أَن تَقَعَ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦٓ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِٱلنَّاسِ لَرَءُوفٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Did	 you	 not	 see	 that	 Allah has	 given	 in	
your	 control	all	 that	is	in	 the	earth	- and	
the	 ship	 that	 moves	 upon	 the	 sea	 by	 His	
command?	 And	 He	 restricts	 the	 heavens	
that	it	may	not	 fall	on	to	the	earth	except	
by	 His	 command;	 indeed	 Allah is	 Most	
Compassionate,	 Most	 Merciful	 upon	
mankind.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	toone	 na	 dekhā	 ke	Allah	 ne	 tumhāre	
bas	meiñ	kardiyā	jo	kuch	zameen	meiñ	hai	
aur	 kashti	 ke	 daryā	 meiñ	 uske	 Hukm	 se	
chalti	 hai	 aur	woh	 roke	 huye	 hai	 āasmān	
ko	 zameen	 par	 na	 gir	 pade	 magar	 uske	
Hukm	se	be-shak	Allah	ādmiyoñ	par	badi	
mehar	(Rahmat) wāla	maherbān hai.
